result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler W. FESSLER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with the sentences imposed on counts 5, 6, 9 and 13 of 17 CF 235 and count 1 of 16 CF 547.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Undergo mental health assessment.

Have no contact with Justice Rezachek and Scott Khail.

Have no contact with Michael & Kathleen Link, Conrad Bartels, William Peroutka, Jill Duzeski, Gregory Bonk, Justin Albino, Kay Bauer, Donald Moss, Zachary Schaaf, Linda Krueger, Philip Krocka, Rosemary Karbon, Roger & Gail Pechinski, Gary Novak, Sr., James Neuser, Jean Sadowski, Donna Gintner, Shawn Thomas, Leo & Diane Schmidt, Michelle Adams, Charlene Hartlaub, Kevin Hartlaub, Scott Johnson, Tracy Williams, Anthony & Kari Posvic, Bruce Peters, Derek Goodman, Joyce Myers, Tricia Ronkowski, April Selner, Jill Schroeder, Michael Piaskowski, Laurie Steeber and James Swiggum.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Count 1 - Burglary - No contest plea.  Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2, 3, 4, 5, &  6 as well as all the uncharged read-ins listed in the plea agreement summary.   Motion granted.  Court orders defendant to submit a DNA sample.   Court orders defendant's bail revoked.   Court further orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.  Report is due by 11-03-17.   Sentencing hearing is set for 11-10-17 at 10:00 a.m.   Defendant is to inform the State of which option he is choosing on the plea agreement summary by 11-03-17.   
Minutes.

Minutes.
RE:  Conrad Bartels, on 11-24-15.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts possess schedule I or II narcotics, 4 counts theft from building, 2 counts possess paraphernalia and receive stolen property.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 12-21-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Conrad Bartels and 1030 S. 23rd Street, Manitowoc, WI; Tricia Ronkowski and 1033 S. 25th Street, Manitowoc, WI; Greg Bonk and 1209 S. 21st Street, Manitowoc, WI; William Peroutka and 1512 Madison Street, Manitowoc, WI and must maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.  Bail is furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
